class abcmodel.radiation.StandardRadiationModel(lat, lon, doy, tstart, cc)[source]#

Standard radiation model with solar position and atmospheric effects.

Calculates time-varying solar radiation based on geographic location and atmospheric conditions. Includes both shortwave (solar) and longwave (thermal) radiation components.

Parameters:

  • lat (-)

  • lon (-)

  • doy (-)

  • tstart (-)

  • cc (-)

  • Processes

  • ---------

  • angles. (1. Calculate solar declination and elevation)

  • transmission. (2. Determine air temperature and atmospheric)

  • radiation. (3. Compute all radiation components and net surface)

Return type:

static calculate_solar_declination(doy)[source]#

Return type:

Array

calculate_solar_elevation(t, dt, solar_declination)[source]#

Calculate solar elevation angle (sine of elevation).

Return type:

Array

run(state, t, dt, const)[source]#

Calculate radiation components and net surface radiation.

class abcmodel.radiation.StandardRadiationwCloudsModel(lat, lon, doy, tstart)[source]#

Standard radiation model with solar position and atmospheric effects including prognostic cloud transmittance.

Calculates time-varying solar radiation based on geographic location and atmospheric conditions. Includes both shortwave (solar) and longwave (thermal) radiation components.

Parameters:

  • lat (-)

  • lon (-)

  • doy (-)

  • tstart (-)

  • Processes

  • ---------

  • angles. (1. Calculate solar declination and elevation)

  • transmission. (2. Determine air temperature and atmospheric)

  • radiation. (3. Compute all radiation components and net surface)

static calculate_atmospheric_transmission_w_clouds(solar_elevation, cl_trans)[source]#

Calculate atmospheric transmission coefficient for solar radiation based on elevation and cloud layer transmittance.

Return type:

Array

run(state, t, dt, const)[source]#

Calculate radiation components and net surface radiation.

class abcmodel.land_surface.AquaCropModel(c3c4, **kwargs)[source]#

AquaCrop land surface model with coupled photosynthesis and stomatal conductance.

A bit more advanced land surface model implementing the AquaCrop approach with coupled photosynthesis-stomatal conductance calculations. Includes detailed biochemical processes for both C3 and C4 vegetation types, soil moisture stress effects, and explicit CO2 flux calculations.

Processes#

  1. Inherit all standard land surface processes from parent class.

  2. Calculate CO2 compensation concentration based on temperature.

  3. Compute mesophyll conductance with temperature response functions.

  4. Determine internal CO2 concentration using stomatal optimization.

  5. Calculate gross primary productivity with light and moisture limitations.

  6. Scale from leaf-level to canopy-level fluxes using extinction functions.

  7. Compute surface resistance from canopy conductance.

  8. Calculate net CO2 fluxes including plant assimilation and soil respiration.

param - all arguments from StandardLandSurfaceParams.:

param - c3c4:

type - c3c4:

plant type, either c3 or c4.

param - co2comp298:

type - co2comp298:

CO2 compensation concentration [mg m-3].

param - net_rad10CO2:

type - net_rad10CO2:

function parameter to calculate CO2 compensation concentration [-].

param - gm298:

type - gm298:

mesophyill conductance at 298 K [mm s-1].

param - ammax298:

type - ammax298:

CO2 maximal primary productivity [mg m-2 s-1].

param - net_rad10gm:

type - net_rad10gm:

function parameter to calculate mesophyll conductance [-].

param - temp1gm:

type - temp1gm:

reference temperature to calculate mesophyll conductance gm [K].

param - temp2gm:

type - temp2gm:

reference temperature to calculate mesophyll conductance gm [K].

param - net_rad10Am:

type - net_rad10Am:

function parameter to calculate maximal primary profuctivity Ammax.

param - temp1Am:

type - temp1Am:

reference temperature to calculate maximal primary profuctivity Ammax [K].

param - temp2Am:

type - temp2Am:

reference temperature to calculate maximal primary profuctivity Ammax [K].

param - f0:

type - f0:

maximum value Cfrac [-].

param - ad:

type - ad:

regression coefficient to calculate Cfrac [kPa-1].

param - alpha0:

type - alpha0:

initial low light conditions [mg J-1].

param - kx:

type - kx:

extinction coefficient PAR [-].

param - gmin:

type - gmin:

cuticular (minimum) conductance [mm s-1].

param - nuco2q:

type - nuco2q:

ratio molecular viscosity water to carbon dioxide.

param - cw:

type - cw:

constant water stress correction (eq. 13 Jacobs et al. 2007) [-].

param - wmax:

type - wmax:

upper reference value soil water [-].

param - wmin:

type - wmin:

lower reference value soil water [-].

param - r10:

type - r10:

respiration at 10 C [mg CO2 m-2 s-1].

param - e0:

type - e0:

activation energy [53.3 kJ kmol-1].

class abcmodel.land_surface.JarvisStewartInitConds(alpha, wg, w2, temp_soil, temp2, surf_temp, wl, rs=1000000.0, rssoil=1000000.0, cliq=nan, temp_soil_tend=nan, wgtend=nan, wltend=nan, le_veg=nan, le_liq=nan, le_soil=nan, le=nan, hf=nan, gf=nan, le_pot=nan, le_ref=nan, ra=nan)[source]#

StandardLandSurfaceInitConds. (- all arguments from)

class abcmodel.land_surface.JarvisStewartModel(**kwargs)[source]#

Jarvis-Stewart land surface model with empirical surface resistance.

Implementation of the Jarvis-Stewart approach for calculating surface resistance based on environmental stress factors. Uses multiplicative stress functions for radiation, soil moisture, vapor pressure deficit, and temperature effects on stomatal conductance.

Processes#

  1. Inherit all standard land surface processes from parent class.

  2. Calculate surface resistance using four environmental stress factors.

  3. Apply Jarvis-Stewart multiplicative stress function approach.

  4. No CO2 flux calculations (simple implementation).

Updates#

  • rs: surface resistance for transpiration [s m-1].

  • all updates from AbstractStandardLandSurfaceModel.

compute_co2_flux(state, const)[source]#

Pass.

compute_surface_resistance(state, const)[source]#

Compute surface resistance using Jarvis-Stewart approach.

Parameters:

  • const (-)

  • radiation (-)

  • surface_layer (-)

  • mixed_layer (-)

  • Updates

  • -------

  • (f1) (Updates self.rs using multiplicative stress factors for radiation)

:param : :param soil moisture (f2): :param vapor pressure deficit (f3): :param and temperature (f4).:

get_f1(state)[source]#

Calculate radiation-dependent scaling factor for surface processes.

Returns correction factor based on incoming solar radiation that typically ranges from 1.0 to higher values, used to scale surface flux calculations.

Return type:

Array

class abcmodel.mixed_layer.BulkMixedLayerModel(divU, coriolis_param, gammatheta, advtheta, beta, gammaq, advq, gammaCO2, advCO2, gammau, advu, gammav, advv, dFz, sw_shearwe=True, sw_fixft=True, sw_wind=True)[source]#

Bulk mixed layer model with full atmospheric boundary layer dynamics.

Complete mixed layer model that simulates atmospheric boundary layer evolution including entrainment, subsidence, cloud effects, and wind dynamics.

Parameters:

  • sw_shearwe (-)

  • sw_fixft (-)

  • sw_wind (-)

  • surf_pressure (-)

  • divU (-)

  • coriolis_param (-)

  • gammatheta (-)

  • advtheta (-)

  • beta (-)

  • gammaq (-)

  • advq (-)

  • gammaCO2 (-)

  • advCO2 (-)

  • gammau (-)

  • advu (-)

  • gammav (-)

  • advv (-)

  • dFz (-)

  • Processes

  • ---------

  • effects. (1. Calculate large-scale vertical motions and compensating)

  • parameters. (2. Determine convective velocity scale and entrainment)

  • variables. (3. Compute all tendency terms for mixed layer)

  • time. (4. Integrate prognostic equations forward in)

class abcmodel.clouds.StandardCumulusInitConds(cc_frac=0.0, cc_mf=0.0, cc_qf=0.0, cl_trans=1.0)[source]#

Standard cumulus model state.

Variables#

  • cc_frac: cloud core fraction [-], range 0 to 1.

  • cc_mf: cloud core mass flux [m/s].

  • cc_qf: cloud core moisture flux [kg/kg/s].

  • cl_trans: cloud layer transmittance [-], range 0 to 1.

class abcmodel.clouds.StandardCumulusModel(tcc_cc=2.0, tcc_trans=0.6)[source]#

Standard cumulus cloud model based on Neggers et al. (2006/7).

This model calculates shallow cumulus convection properties using a variance-based approach to determine cloud core fraction and associated mass fluxes. The model characterizes turbulent fluctuations in the mixed layer that lead to cloud formation. It quantifies the variance of humidity and CO2 at the mixed-layer top and uses this to determine what fraction reaches saturation.

Parameters:

  • tcc_cc (-)

  • tcc_trans (-)

  • Processes

  • ---------

  • top (1. Calculates turbulent variance for humidity and CO2 at the mixed-layer)

  • 2006/7). (using entrainment fluxes and convective scaling (Neggers et al.)

  • using (2. Determines fraction of mixed-layer top that becomes saturated)

  • deficit. (arctangent formulation based on saturation)

  • cores. (3. Calculates mass flux and moisture flux through cloud)

  • height. (4. Computes CO2 transport only when CO2 decreases with)

static calculate_cloud_core_fraction(q, top_T, top_p, q2_h)[source]#

Calculate cloud core fraction using the arctangent formulation.

Return type:

Array

static calculate_cloud_core_properties(cc_frac, wstar, q2_h)[source]#

Calculate and update cloud core mass flux and moisture flux. No return needed since were updating self attributes directly.

Return type:

tuple[Array, Array]

calculate_cloud_layer_transmittance(cc_frac)[source]#

Calculate cloud layer transmittance, with maximum total cloud cover equal to 1

Return type:

Array

static calculate_co2_mass_flux(cc_mf, top_CO22, dCO2)[source]#

Calculate CO2 mass flux, only if mixed-layer top jump is negative.

Return type:

Array

static calculate_mixed_layer_variance(cc_qf, wthetav, wqe, dq, abl_height, dz_h, wstar, wCO2e, wCO2M, dCO2)[source]#

Calculate mixed-layer top relative humidity variance and CO2 variance. Based on Neggers et. al 2006/7.

Return type:

tuple[Array, Array]

run(state, const)[source]#

State requirements#

  • wthetav : float - Virtual potential temperature flux [K m/s]

  • wqe : float - Moisture flux at entrainment [kg/kg m/s]

  • dq : float - Moisture jump at mixed-layer top [kg/kg]

  • abl_height : float - Atmospheric boundary layer height [m]

  • dz_h : float - Layer thickness at mixed-layer top [m]

  • wstar : float - Convective velocity scale [m/s]

  • wCO2e : float - CO2 flux at entrainment [ppm m/s]

  • wCO2M : float - CO2 mass flux [ppm m/s]

  • dCO2 : float - CO2 jump at mixed-layer top [ppm]

  • q : float - Specific humidity [kg/kg]

  • top_T : float - Temperature at mixed-layer top [K]

  • top_p : float - Pressure at mixed-layer top [Pa]

Updates#

  • cc_fracfloat

    Cloud core fraction (0 to 1)

  • cc_mffloat

    Cloud core mass flux [m/s]

  • cc_qffloat

    Cloud core moisture flux [kg/kg/s]

  • q2_hfloat

    Humidity variance at mixed-layer top

  • top_CO22float

    CO2 variance at mixed-layer top

  • wCO2Mfloat

    CO2 mass flux [ppm m/s]

  • cl_trans: float

    cloud layer transmissivity [-]
